refnamediv.refpurpose: Cancel and clean up a GRAM batch job

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &cmd; program cancels the job named by JOBID if it is still running, and then removes any cached files on the GRAM service node related to that job. In order to do the file clean up, it submits a job which removes the cache files. By default this cleanup job is submitted to the default GRAM resource running on the same host as the job. This behavior can be controlled by specifying a resource manager contact string as the parameter to the -r or -resource option.
By default, &cmd; prompts the user prior to canceling the job. This behavior can be overridden by specifying the -f or -force command-line options.

refsect1.title: Options
refsect1.para:
The full set of options to &cmd; are:
-help -usage Display a help message to standard error and exit.
-version Display the software version of the &cmd; program to standard output.
-version Display the software version of the &cmd; program including DiRT information to standard output.
-resource RESOURCE -r RESOURCE Submit the clean-up job to the resource named by RESOURCE instead of the default GRAM service on the same host as the job contact.
-force -f Do not prompt to confirm job cancel and clean-up.
-quiet -q Do not print diagnostics for succesful clean-up. Implies -f

refsect1.title: ENVIRONMENT
refsect1.para:
If the following variables affect the execution of &cmd;.
X509_USER_PROXY Path to proxy credential.
X509_CERT_DIR Path to trusted certificate directory.
